author: mattypatty
title: Great way to round off The 20th anniversary figures
review: Obi-wan is a wonderful addition to the 20th anniversary figures already out and I knew as soon as I saw him that I had to add him to my collection.  The printing is very period correct, and the stand is the exact same as all the other figures, with the obvious exception of it saying Obi-wan Kenobi.  Overall a wonderful figure and great display piece.

author: Lobo_da_boss_
title: Why is this my only 20th anniversary figure
review:
Opening;

This a good polybag especially as a promo as I got it but being my only 20th anniversary figure it just looks out of place .

Minifigure-

The figure uses the classic make hair piece in light grey , a remake his original face , his classic torso with added anniversary logo back printing , some unprinted legs and he wields a blue bladed lightsaber .

The build-

The build is very basic and features one printed piece and an extra 2×4 black plate to connect to other stands .

In conclusion-

This is a good polybag in its own right but for me when I look at it I feel empty , those anniversary sets were so good and I have no clue why orient get all of them get this if you have them and get this if you want it .

author: CreditBuilds
title: 20th Anniversary Obi-Wan Polybag
review: Originally this 20th Anniversary Obi-Wan minifig was only available if you purchased a certain amount of LEGO worth whatever amount of money you needed to qualify for the promotion. LEGO must of had extra stock because they started selling them for $4 or the equivalent of that in your currency. This significantly brought down their value. But the figure is good, they perfectly captured the old style minifig that they were going for. The base is nice with is name displayed on it, it's base is also compatible with the other 20th Anniversary figures. This polybag isn't really made for play which is why I gave it a low playability score. Overall 5/5, it's a great figure and looks nice with the other 20th Anniversary figs.
